verses.verse: PSALM 58Prayer for the Punishment of the Wicked.For the music director; set toAl-tashheth. A Mikhtam of David. (Lit Do Not Destroy) (Possibly Epigrammatic Poem or Atonement Psalm) Do you indeed (Another reading is speak righteousness in silence) speak righteousness, you (Or mighty ones; or judges) gods? Do you judge (Or mankind fairly?) fairly, you sons of mankind?
No, in heart you practice injustice; On earth you clear a way for the violence of your hands.
The wicked have turned away from the womb; These who speak lies go astray from (Lit the womb) birth.
They have venom like the venom of a serpent; Like a deaf cobra that stops up its ear,
So that it does not hear the voice of (Or whisperers) charmers, Or a skillful caster of spells.
God, shatter their teeth in their mouth; Break out the fangs of the young lions, LORD.
May they flow away like water that runs off; When he (Lit bends) aims his arrows, may they be as (Lit though they were cut off) headless shafts.
May they be like a snail which goes along in slime, Like the miscarriage of a woman that never sees the sun.
Before your pots can feel the fire of thorns He will sweep them away with a whirlwind, the (Lit living) green and the burning alike.
The righteous will rejoice when he sees vengeance; He will wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.
And people will say, “There certainly is (Lit fruit) a reward for the righteous; There certainly is a God who judges on the earth!”
